Comments_List: I learned how to evaluate and look at society differently.  I learned a lot about feminism and the ability to empower every person in society.
I was able to develop skills such as writing a more personal essay, insight/analysis, and writing in general.

I liked how my own beliefs and thoughts were encouraged to be said and written in essays.  The ability to go to several different class visits to museums and other sites allowed a real life explanation for what we were reading outside of class.
I thought this class was very interesting. The activities that are done in the class are engaging and interesting. Gives a new perspective on a ton of social issues across gender, race, and class.
Yes.  The course definitely has made me view the world differently and put myself in someone else shoes in a less fortunate situation than myself.

I would recommend taking this class in the summer because of the kitchen table talks allow for a more engaging conversation on gender studies in the classroom. A lot of the activities are really fun as well. Really recommend it.
